subject: p17838301
Findings: The heart is moderately enlarged. The aortic arch is calcified. The mediastinal and hilar contours appear unchanged. The lung volumes are low. Calcified pleural plaques are present. There is no definite pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Band-like opacity in the left mid lung suggests minor atelectasis or scarring. Pulmonary vessels are somewhat engorged centrally suggesting pulmonary venous hypertension if not frank pulmonary edema. There is a confluent right basilar opacity worrisome for pneumonia.
Impression: Focal right basilar opacity worrisome for pneumonia. Mildly prominent pulmonary vasculature suggesting pulmonary venous hypertension, but not frank pulmonary edema. Moderate cardiomegaly. Calcified pleural plaques.
